intro: Ditassa farneyi, commonly known as the Farney's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub with lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. The plant's botanical features make it an important species in its native ecosystem.
